page.title: 06Nottingham Airport
page.content: {Nottingham Airport}is situated on the road from Gamston to Tollerton. It was opened in 1930. It is not used as an international airport but is used for light aircraft and charter and cargo work. The Airport covers 288 acres. On this there are three runways going in different directions. There are two hangars where the aeroplanes are stored and there is the control tower. How much the Airport is used depends a bit on the weather but on an average day there are about 120 aeroplanes using the Airport. Twelve people are employed there, including the Director, the Air Traffic Controller and mechanics who look after the maintainance of the aircraft.
